description: {"blocks":[{"key":"adiso","text":"The trigeminal ganglion houses somatosensory neurons that innervate peripheral structures throughout the head and face. This protocol describes step-by-step instruction to perform a non-survival surgery for visualizing the ganglia. We apply this procedure to record calcium responses from the mouse trigeminal sensory neurons in vivo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":326,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ue72","text":"Begin to suction out the cortex with the large suction pipet, starting anteriorly and traveling around the edge of the window on the left and right sides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6073","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8m1gp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erahv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ai8k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bhl6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f9c9n","text":"If brain is harshly lifted at any time by the suction pipet during the procedure, switch to a smaller suction pipet.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cl7b8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"197t","text":"Do NOT suction in a back-and-forth motion, rather usr a rapid blotting motion (blotting = up and down) while regularly irrigating with 37°C 1X PBS ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eok52","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ajivt","text":" There is usually a lot of brain hiding underneath the skull; steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1cr2","text":"Fill the skull with 37°C 1X PBS and reduce isofluorane an additional 1/4th of the starting concentration (e.g., if starting at 2%, the isofluorane should be reduced to 1.5% during the procedure, and 1% once the brain is removed).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Bilateral Hemispherectomy and Exposure of Trigeminal Ganglia
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"71fle","text":"Within the skull, you should now observe a blood clot with a gelatin-like consistency. Begin removing the clot by suctioning from the sides of the skull, and dragging the clot across the TG to uncover it. Remove all of the clot, but do not touch the TGs with the suction pipet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lcca","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"egknu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"evnk2","text":"If the blood clot is not thick, refill the skull with PBS and wait 3-5 more minutes for clot to form.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Procedure Overview
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5hqn6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kijr","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"egemi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"62879880D02E11EDBE990DCB2E49439B","height":838,"id":362781,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":88,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"cp6fr","text":"Overview of Bilateral Hemispherectomy Procedure. Step-by-step description follows below.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fdm68","text":"A. Mouse must be anesthetized and secured in the stereotaxic apparatus.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13ghf","text":"B. The scalp is removed to enable access to the skull.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"38n07","text":"C. The skull is fully exposed with all overlying residual tissue removed.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b65a1","text":"D. The lateral edges of the skull are drilled in a pear shape, taking care not to puncture the underlying brain.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"17mu5","text":"E. The causal and rostral midline skull is cut, to release the skull cap.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":34,"offset":3,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9poge","text":"F. See procotol for complete details. Briefly, the skull cap is removed to create a window and fully expose the dorsal view of the brain. The superficial cortex is removed around the edge and then middle of the window. Brain tissue is removed from the anterior portion of the window to expose the rostral portion of the trigeminal ganglia. Remove the brain tissue over the midline. Avoid the caudal midline to prevent damage to brainstem. Finish removing brain from over the TGs.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6qjqs","text":"G. After clotting and clot removal the TG can be visualized for imaging. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Protocol figure.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mci9b3yj7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mci7b3yj7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mci8b3yj7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mci6b3yj7.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Positioning the mouse in the stereotax
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cf1vv","text":"Position ear bars in the ear canals so that head is immobilized with the top of the head as flat as possible. A line through bregma to lambda should also be parallel to the ground.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3spmj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f249r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9un60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ln0h","text":"Ear canals tend to be lower and near eye level. Start by fastening the first ear bar lightly against the ear, approximately where you expect the canal to be. Next, insert the opposite ear bar and search until you catch the tip in the canal, so that slight vertical displacement of the ear bar steadily controls head movement in the same direction; fasten the ear bar to hold this position. Repeat with the opposite side so that the head is immobilized. Next, slowly inch up each side with the ear bars until the head is raised so that the front legs are almost entirely extended upwards, with the feet still contacting the platform. Ensure both ears are parallel so that the top the head is as flat as possible. It is helpful to adjust the palette bar as necessary while raising and flattening the head.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
